event.doc_name: Underlying Decision from Which Petition Arises

evidence.text: requirements that owners or operators must use the Modified El Paso Method and repair leaks of total strippable hydrocarbon concentration (as methane) in the stripping gas of 6.2 ppmv or greater within 15 days from the sampling date
evidence.source_document: Underlying Decision from Which Petition Arises

add_extracted.value: Owners and operators must use the Modified El Paso Method and repair leaks of total strippable hydrocarbon concentration (as methane) in the stripping gas of 6.2 ppmv or greater within 15 days from the sampling date

evidence.text: requirements that owners and operators must reduce emissions of EtO from storage vessels in EtO service by either: (1) Venting emissions through a closed-vent system to a control device that reduces EtO by greater than or equal to 99.9 percent by weight or to a concentration less than 1 ppmv for each storage vessel vent; or (2) venting emissions through a closed-vent system to a flare meeting the operating and monitoring requirements for flares in NESHAP subpart F
evidence.source_document: Underlying Decision from Which Petition Arises

add_extracted.value: Owners and operators must reduce emissions of EtO from storage vessels in EtO service by venting through closed-vent system to control device reducing EtO by ≥99.9% by weight or to concentration <1 ppmv per vessel, or through closed-vent system to flare meeting operating requirements

evidence.text: requirements that owners and operators must reduce emissions of EtO from process vents in EtO service by either: (1) Venting emissions through a closed-vent system to a control device that reduces EtO by greater than or equal to 99.9 percent by weight, to a concentration less than 1 ppmv for each process vent, or to less than 5 pound per year (lb/yr) for all combined process vents per chemical manufacturing process unit (CMPU); or (2) venting emissions through a closed-vent system to a flare meeting the operating and monitoring requirements for flares in NESHAP subpart F
evidence.source_document: Underlying Decision from Which Petition Arises

add_extracted.value: Owners and operators must reduce emissions of EtO from process vents in EtO service by venting through closed-vent system to control device reducing EtO by ≥99.9% by weight or to concentration <1 ppmv per vent, or through closed-vent system to flare meeting operating requirements
